009package com.weather.sdk.model;
010
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015/**
016 * Represents wind data including speed and direction information.
017 *
018 * <p>This class encapsulates wind information from the OpenWeatherAPI response, providing the wind
019 * speed in meters per second and optionally wind direction in degrees.
020 *
021 * <h2>Wind Speed Characteristics</h2>
022 *
023 * <ul>
024 *   <li><strong>Speed:</strong> Wind speed in meters per second (m/s)
025 *   <li><strong>Direction:</strong> Wind direction in meteorological degrees (0-360°)
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * <h2>Wind Speed Reference</h2>
029 *
030 * <ul>
031 *   <li>0-2 m/s: Calm to light air (0-4.5 mph)
032 *   <li>2-4 m/s: Light breeze (4.5-9 mph)
033 *   <li>4-8 m/s: Moderate breeze (9-18 mph)
034 *   <li>8-13 m/s: Fresh breeze (18-29 mph)
035 *   <li>13-18 m/s: Strong breeze (29-40 mph)
036 *   <li>18-25 m/s: Near gale (40-55 mph)
037 *   <li>25+ m/s: Gale or higher (55+ mph)
038 * </ul>
039 *
040 * <h2>JSON Mapping</h2>
041 *
042 * <p>Mapped from OpenWeatherAPI response:
043 *
044 * <pre>
045 * {
046 *   "wind": {
047 *     "speed": 5.2,
048 *     "deg": 270
049 *   }
050 * }
051 * </pre>
052 *
053 * @since 1.0.0
054 */
055@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
056@SuppressWarnings({
057  "PMD.ShortClassName", // "Wind" is a domain-appropriate name
058  "PMD.TooManyMethods" // Domain model with rich wind-related functionality
059})
060public final class Wind {
061
062  /** Beaufort scale 1 upper limit in m/s. */
063  private static final double BEAUFORT_1_MAX = 1.5;
064
065  /** Beaufort scale 2 upper limit in m/s. */
066  private static final double BEAUFORT_2_MAX = 3.3;
067
068  /** Beaufort scale 3 upper limit in m/s. */
069  private static final double BEAUFORT_3_MAX = 5.4;
070
071  /** Beaufort scale 4 upper limit in m/s. */
072  private static final double BEAUFORT_4_MAX = 7.9;
073
074  /** Beaufort scale 5 upper limit in m/s. */
075  private static final double BEAUFORT_5_MAX = 10.7;
076
077  /** Beaufort scale 6 upper limit in m/s. */
078  private static final double BEAUFORT_6_MAX = 13.8;
079
080  /** Beaufort scale 7 upper limit in m/s. */
081  private static final double BEAUFORT_7_MAX = 17.1;
082
083  /** Beaufort scale 8 upper limit in m/s. */
084  private static final double BEAUFORT_8_MAX = 20.7;
085
086  /** Beaufort scale 9 upper limit in m/s. */
087  private static final double BEAUFORT_9_MAX = 24.4;
088
089  /** Beaufort scale 10 upper limit in m/s. */
090  private static final double BEAUFORT_10_MAX = 28.4;
091
092  /** Beaufort scale 11 upper limit in m/s. */
093  private static final double BEAUFORT_11_MAX = 32.6;
094
095  /** Strong wind threshold in m/s. */
096  private static final double WIND_STRONG = 13.0;
097
098  /** Calm wind threshold in m/s. */
099  private static final double WIND_CALM = 2.0;
100
101  /** Beaufort scale 0 upper limit in m/s. */
102  private static final double BEAUFORT_0_MAX = 0.0;
103
104  /** The wind speed in meters per second. */
105  @JsonProperty("speed")
106  private double speed;
107
108  /** The wind direction in degrees (0-360), or null if not available. */
109  @JsonProperty("deg")
110  private Integer direction;
111
112  /** Default constructor for Jackson deserialization. */
113  public Wind() {
114    // Default constructor for Jackson
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Constructs a new Wind instance with speed and optional direction.
119   *
120   * @param speed the wind speed in meters per second. Must be non-negative.
121   * @param direction the wind direction in degrees (0-360), or null if not available.
122   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if speed is negative or direction is out of range
123   */
124  public Wind(final double speed, final Integer direction) {
125    setSpeed(speed);
126    setDirection(direction);
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Constructs a new Wind instance with speed only (no direction information).
131   *
132   * @param speed the wind speed in meters per second. Must be non-negative.
133   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if speed is negative
134   */
135  public Wind(final double speed) {
136    this(speed, null);
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Returns the wind speed in meters per second.
141   *
142   * @return the wind speed in m/s. Always non-negative.
143   */
144  public double getSpeed() {
145    return speed;
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Returns the wind direction in meteorological degrees.
150   *
151   * @return the wind direction in degrees (0-360), or null if not available
152   */
153  public Integer getDirection() {
154    return direction;
155  }
156
157  /**
158   * Sets the wind speed in meters per second.
159   *
160   * @param speed the wind speed in meters per second. Must be non-negative.
161   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if speed is negative
162   */
163  public void setSpeed(final double speed) {
164    if (speed < 0) {
165      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Wind speed must be non-negative, was: " + speed + " m/s");
166    }
167    this.speed = speed;
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Sets the wind direction in degrees (0-360).
172   *
173   * @param direction the wind direction in degrees (0-360), or null if not available.
174   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if direction is out of range
175   */
176  public void setDirection(final Integer direction) {
177    if (direction != null && (direction < 0 || direction > 360)) {
178      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Wind direction must be 0-360 degrees, was: " + direction);
179    }
180    this.direction = direction;
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * Converts wind speed to miles per hour.
185   *
186   * @return the wind speed in mph
187   */
188  public double getSpeedMph() {
189    return speed * 2.237; // m/s to mph
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Converts wind speed to kilometers per hour.
194   *
195   * @return the wind speed in km/h
196   */
197  public double getSpeedKmh() {
198    return speed * 3.6; // m/s to km/h
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Converts wind speed to knots (nautical miles per hour).
203   *
204   * @return the wind speed in knots
205   */
206  public double getSpeedKnots() {
207    return speed * 1.943_84; // m/s to knots
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Returns the wind direction as a cardinal direction (N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW).
212   *
213   * @return the cardinal direction, or null if direction is not available
214   */
215  public String getCardinalDirection() {
216    final String result;
217    if (direction == null) {
218      result = null;
219    } else {
220      final String[] directions = {
221        "N", "NNE", "NE", "ENE", "E", "ESE", "SE", "SSE", "S", "SSW", "SW", "WSW", "W", "WNW", "NW",
222        "NNW"
223      };
224
225      final int index = (int) Math.round(direction / 22.5) % 16;
226      result = directions[index];
227    }
228    return result;
229  }
230
231  /**
232   * Checks if the wind is coming from the specified direction range.
233   *
234   * @param center the center direction in degrees (0-360)
235   * @param range the range in degrees on either side of center (e.g., 45° for 8 compass points)
236   * @return true if wind is from the specified direction range
237   */
238  public boolean isFromDirection(final double center, final double range) {
239    final boolean result;
240    if (direction == null) {
241      result = false;
242    } else {
243      final double normalizedCenter = ((center - range) % 360 + 360) % 360;
244      final double normalizedEnd = ((center + range) % 360 + 360) % 360;
245      final double normalizedDir = ((direction - range) % 360 + 360) % 360;
246
247      if (normalizedCenter <= normalizedEnd) {
248        result = normalizedDir >= normalizedCenter && normalizedDir <= normalizedEnd;
249      } else {
250        // Range crosses 0°/360° boundary
251        result = normalizedDir >= normalizedCenter || normalizedDir <= normalizedEnd;
252      }
253    }
254    return result;
255  }
256
257  /**
258   * Indicates whether the wind is considered strong (≥ 13 m/s or 29+ mph).
259   *
260   * @return true if wind is strong, false otherwise
261   */
262  public boolean isStrong() {
263    return speed >= WIND_STRONG;
264  }
265
266  /**
267   * Indicates whether the wind is considered calm or light (≤ 2 m/s or ≤ 4.5 mph).
268   *
269   * @return true if wind is calm to light, false otherwise
270   */
271  public boolean isCalm() {
272    return speed <= WIND_CALM;
273  }
274
275  /**
276   * Gets the Beaufort scale equivalent for the wind speed.
277   *
278   * <p>Beaufort Scale:
279   *
280   * <ul>
281   *   <li>0: Calm (0 m/s)
282   *   <li>1: Light air (0.3-1.5 m/s)
283   *   <li>2: Light breeze (1.6-3.3 m/s)
284   *   <li>3: Gentle breeze (3.4-5.4 m/s)
285   *   <li>4: Moderate breeze (5.5-7.9 m/s)
286   *   <li>5: Fresh breeze (8.0-10.7 m/s)
287   *   <li>6: Strong breeze (10.8-13.8 m/s)
288   *   <li>7: Near gale (13.9-17.1 m/s)
289   *   <li>8: Gale (17.2-20.7 m/s)
290   *   <li>9: Severe gale (20.8-24.4 m/s)
291   *   <li>10: Storm (24.5-28.4 m/s)
292   *   <li>11: Violent storm (28.5-32.6 m/s)
293   *   <li>12: Hurricane force (32.7+ m/s)
294   * </ul>
295   *
296   * @return the Beaufort scale number (0-12)
297   */
298  public int getBeaufortScale() {
299    final double[] beaufortLimits = {
300      BEAUFORT_0_MAX, BEAUFORT_1_MAX, BEAUFORT_2_MAX, BEAUFORT_3_MAX,
301      BEAUFORT_4_MAX, BEAUFORT_5_MAX, BEAUFORT_6_MAX, BEAUFORT_7_MAX,
302      BEAUFORT_8_MAX, BEAUFORT_9_MAX, BEAUFORT_10_MAX, BEAUFORT_11_MAX
303    };
304
305    int result = 12;
306    for (int i = 0; i < beaufortLimits.length; i++) {
307      if (speed <= beaufortLimits[i]) {
308        result = i;
309        break;
310      }
311    }
312    return result;
313  }
314
315  /**
316   * Gets a human-readable description of the wind conditions.
317   *
318   * @return a descriptive wind condition
319   */
320  public String getDescription() {
321    final int scale = getBeaufortScale();
322    return getBeaufortDescription(scale);
323  }
324
325  /**
326   * Gets the Beaufort scale description for the given scale number.
327   *
328   * @param scale the Beaufort scale number (0-12)
329   * @return the description of the Beaufort scale level
330   */
331  public String getBeaufortDescription(final int scale) {
332    final String[] descriptions = {
333      "Calm",
334      "Light air",
335      "Light breeze",
336      "Gentle breeze",
337      "Moderate breeze",
338      "Fresh breeze",
339      "Strong breeze",
340      "Near gale",
341      "Gale",
342      "Severe gale",
343      "Storm",
344      "Violent storm",
345      "Hurricane force"
346    };
347
348    final String result;
349    if (scale >= 0 && scale < descriptions.length) {
350      result = descriptions[scale];
351    } else {
352      result = "Unknown";
353    }
354    return result;
355  }
356
357  /**
358   * Returns a formatted wind string.
359   *
360   * @return formatted wind information
361   */
362  public String format() {
363    final String result;
364    if (direction != null) {
365      result =
366          String.format(
367              "Wind{%.1f m/s (%s) from %s (%d°)}",
368              speed, getDescription(), getCardinalDirection(), direction);
369    } else {
370      result = String.format("Wind{%.1f m/s (%s)}", speed, getDescription());
371    }
372    return result;
373  }
374
375  @Override
376  public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
377    final boolean result;
378    if (this == obj) {
379      result = true;
380    } else if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
381      result = false;
382    } else {
383      final Wind wind = (Wind) obj;
384      result = Double.compare(speed, wind.speed) == 0 && Objects.equals(direction, wind.direction);
385    }
386    return result;
387  }
388
389  @Override
390  public int hashCode() {
391    return Objects.hash(speed, direction);
392  }
393
394  @Override
395  public String toString() {
396    return format();
397  }
398}
